abstract: Thomas Hoenig, nominated to be vice chairman of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, brings a clear understanding of the banking system and the perils of "too big to fail" banks, an economist writes.
snippet: Thomas Hoenig, nominated to be vice chairman of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, brings a clear understanding of the banking system and the perils of "too big to fail" banks, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Simon Johnson, the former chief economist at the International Monetary Fund, is the co-author of "13 Bankers."
